snippet: The federal government said it wanted records from Armstrong’s 1996 cancer treatments because they could prove just how far he was willing to go to conceal his drug use.
abstract: Federal investigators seek records of cyclist Lance Armstrong's cancer treatment, hoping to discover whether he told doctors about his use of performance enhancing drugs and lengths he went to in attempt to hide evidence.
lead_paragraph: The federal government said it wanted records from Armstrong’s 1996 cancer treatments because they could prove just how far he was willing to go to conceal his drug use.

headline.main: U.S. Explains Push for Lance Armstrong Data
headline.print_headline: U.S. Explains Push for Armstrong Data
